first_paycheck: Congratulations! Your first paycheck of €{monthly_income} just hit your account. This is an exciting moment - your hard work is paying off! How will you handle this money?
budget_decision: You've been tracking your spending and noticed it's time to get more intentional with your budget. With €{monthly_income} coming in monthly and €{monthly_expenses} going out, what's your strategy?
emergency_fund: You've been thinking about financial security. Experts recommend having 3-6 months of expenses saved for emergencies. That would be €{target} for you. How will you approach this?
investment_opportunity: You've learned about investing and compound interest. With €{money} in your account, you're wondering if it's time to put some money to work in the market. What's your move?
career_opportunity: An opportunity has come up at work. You could take on more responsibility, invest in training, or maintain your current balance. Each option has trade-offs. What do you choose?
lifestyle_choice: You're thinking about how to spend your free time and money. Investing in yourself through fitness, hobbies, or education could pay dividends, but so could saving that money. What feels right?
debt_management: You currently have €{debts} in debt. It's weighing on your mind. Should you aggressively pay it down, or focus on other financial goals? Let's think strategically.
social_event: Friends are making plans and you want to join. Maintaining relationships is important for happiness, but it often costs money. How do you balance social life with financial goals?
education_opportunity: You've been thinking about improving your financial knowledge. There are courses, books, and free resources available. Investing in your financial education could help you make better decisions. What's your approach?
default: A new situation has come up. What will you do?
